```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```



Load Packages and Dataset
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(modelr)


```

Simulate two datasets
```{r}
set.seed(1)

n_samp = 250

sim_df_const = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n_samp, 1, 1),
    error = rnorm(n_samp, 0, 1),
    y = 2 + 3 * x + error
  )

sim_df_nonconst = 
  sim_df_const |> 
  mutate(
  error = error * .75 * x,
  y = 2 + 3 * x + error
)

```

Look at this data 
```{r}
sim_df_nonconst |> 
  ggplot(aes(x=x, y=y)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .5)
```

What does `lm` do for these?
```{r}
sim_df_const |> 
  lm( y~x, data= _) |> 
  broom::tidy() |>  
  knitr:: kable(digits=3)

sim_df_nonconst |>  
  lm(y ~ x, data= _) |>  
  broom::tidy() |>  
  knitr:: kable(digits=3)
```
